intro: Astraea glandulifera, commonly known as the glandular astraea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale green, with a distinctive structure that includes prominent glandular hairs. Astraea glandulifera is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
